snippet: The unrest at South African mines has placed the spotlight on the country’s business leaders and politicians, who once led protests and are now wealthy members of the establishment.
abstract: Unrest and massive protests at South African mines have placed a harsh spotlight on the country’s business leaders and politicians, who once led protests and are now wealthy members of the establishment; seething rage among the country's poor, especially following the shooting of 34 workers by police, is presenting the greatest challenge the African National Congress has faced since it took power in 1994.
lead_paragraph: The unrest at South African mines has placed the spotlight on the country’s business leaders and politicians, who once led protests and are now wealthy members of the establishment.

headline.seo: Rage by Miners Points to Shift in South Africa
headline.main: Rage by Miners Points to Shift in South Africa
headline.print_headline: Rage by Miners Points to Shift In South Africa
